examples: dogs, foxes, and the like", "we don't want the likes of you around here
We'll not see his like again
I can't tolerate people of his ilk

results.definition: prefer or wish to do something
examples: Do you care to try this dish?
Would you like to come along to the movies?
I like jogging
She likes to read Russian novels
I like my nephews

results.definition: feel about or towards; consider, evaluate, or regard
examples: How did you like the President's speech last night?
I'd like a beer now!

results.definition: resembling or similar; having the same or some of the same characteristics; often used in combination
examples: suits of like design
a limited circle of like minds
members of the cat family have like dispositions
as like as two peas in a pod
doglike devotion
a dreamlike quality
like amounts
equivalent amounts
the same amount
gave one six blows and the other a like number
the same number

results.definition: having the same or similar characteristics
examples: all politicians are alike
they looked utterly alike
friends are generally alike in background and taste
boxes with corresponding dimensions
the like period of the preceding year
